00152   {
00153     double result = 0;
00154     // On some runs in Linux calling av_q2d will raise
00155     // a FPE instead of returning back NaN or infinity,
00156     // so we try to short-circuit that here.
00157     if (mRational.den == 0)
00158       if (mRational.num == 0)
00159         result = std::numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN();
00160       else
00161         result = std::numeric_limits<double>::infinity();
00162     else
00163       result =  av_q2d(mRational);
00164     return result;

int32_t com::xuggle::xuggler::Rational::reduce ( int64_t  num,
int64_t  den,
int64_t  max 
) [virtual]

Reduce a fraction to it's lowest common denominators.

This is useful for framerate calculations.

Parameters:
num the src numerator.
den the src denominator.
max the maximum allowed for nom & den in the reduced fraction.
Returns:
1 if exact, 0 otherwise

Rational * com::xuggle::xuggler::Rational::make ( Rational *  src  )  [static]

Creates copy of a Rational from another Rational.

Note: This is a NEW object. To just keep tabs on the original, use acquire() to keep a reference.

Parameters:
src The source Rational to copy.
Returns:
A new Rational; caller must call release. Returns null if src is null.

Rational * com::xuggle::xuggler::Rational::make ( int32_t  num,
int32_t  den 
) [static]

Create a rational from a numerator and denominator.

We will always reduce this to the lowest num/den pair we can, but never having den exceed what was passed in.

Parameters:
num The numerator of the resulting Rational
den The denominator of the resulting Rational
Returns:
A new Rational; caller must call release.

Reimplemented from com::xuggle::xuggler::IRational.

00136       result->init();

int64_t com::xuggle::xuggler::Rational::rescale ( int64_t  srcValue,
int32_t  dstNumerator,
int32_t  dstDenominator,
int32_t  srcNumerator,
int32_t  srcDenominator,
Rounding  rounding 
) [static]

Rescales a long value to another long value.

This method doesn't use IRational values, but instead uses numerators and denominators passed in by the caller. It will not result in any memory allocations.

Parameters:
srcValue The value to rescale.
dstNumerator The numerator of the units you want to scale to. Must be non-zero.
dstDenominator The denominator of the units you want to scale to. Must be non-zero.
srcNumerator The numerator of the units srcValue is expressed in. Must be non-zero.
srcDenominator The denominator of the units srcValue is expressed in. Must be non-zero.
rounding How you want rounding to occur
Returns:
The new integer value, scaled in units of dstNumerator/dstNumerator, or 0 if there is a parameter error.

Reimplemented from com::xuggle::xuggler::IRational.

Definition at line 275 of file Rational.cpp.

00281   {
00282     int64_t retval = srcValue;
00283     if (!dstNumerator || !dstDenominator ||
00284         !srcNumerator || !srcDenominator)
00285       return 0;
00286 
00287     int64_t b = srcNumerator * (int64_t)dstDenominator;
00288     int64_t c = dstNumerator * (int64_t)srcDenominator;
00289 
00290     retval = av_rescale_rnd(srcValue, b,
00291         c, (enum AVRounding)rounding);
00292 
00293     return retval;
00294   }

void com::xuggle::xuggler::Rational::init (  )  [virtual]

Marks this object as finalized and immutable.

Any setters called after the first init() call will be ignored.

Most make methods will call this method automatically, with the exception of the blank factory method make().

Since:
3.2
